intro: Dapania pentandra, commonly known as the white dapania, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appearance. Dapania pentandra is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
